column2: MS DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Mississippi
column6: MS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
column4: yield the right of way at corners only.
column6: help the pedestrian cross the street.

column2: 2. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column8: increase their speed and keep well to the right.

column2: 3. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 4. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 5. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Leave the road immediately.
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 6. Drivers have to yield to pedestrians:
column4: only if the pedestrians have a green light.
column6: only when the pedestrian is in the crosswalk.
column8: even if the pedestrian is not obeying traffic controls.

column2: 7. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column8: near the left edge of the road.

column2: 8. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: signal other vehicles to stop.
column6: come to a complete stop.
column8: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 9. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 10. When driving in rainy weather, you should:
column4: steer and brake smoothly.
column6: steer off the road.

column2: 11. This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
column4: a railroad crossing.
column6: a crosswalk.

column2: 12. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column6: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column2: 13. You arrive at an intersection where you have a green light, but the path ahead is blocked, you should:
column4: turn left and find another route.
column6: stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
column8: enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.

column2: 14. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Hospital service
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 15. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column6: Drive with caution.
column8: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 16. A diamond-shaped sign is a:
column4: school zone sign.
column6: regulatory sign.

column2: 17. Drivers should not sound their horn when:
column4: they may hit another vehicle.
column6: near blind pedestrians.

column2: 18. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column4: fresh air.
column6: drinking coffee.
column8: not to drink over a period of time.

column2: 19. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 20. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: drive a few MPH faster than most.
column6: drive a few MPH slower than most.

column2: 21. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 22. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.

column2: 23. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: look and listen for trains.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 25. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column8: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 26. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Rely on your mirrors.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 27. Drivers may legally block an intersection:
column4: under no circumstances.
column6: only after entering the intersection on a green light.

column2: 28. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Run away.
column6: Do not panic.

column2: 29. To drive defensively you should:
column4: look only at the car in front of you while driving.
column6: keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
column8: always put one car length between you and the car ahead.

column2: 30. In work zones, barriers such as drums, panels and cones are used to:
column4: keep workers out of the work zone.
column6: keep traffic out of hazardous work zones.
